Brain Worms

Welcome to another absolutely unhinged week in tech, where AI models are casually revolutionizing physics while developers are getting pwned by browser extensions they installed because they had pretty icons. It's 2026 and we're living in a simulation where Chinese hackers are more patient than your therapist, Microsoft Teams outages are considered divine intervention, and Australia's government thinks the best way to protect kids is to isolate them completely. Buckle up, because this week's news reads like a cyberpunk novel written by a caffeinated AI that's been binge-watching tech conference fails.

VSCode Extensions: The Trojan Horse of Modern Dev Life

TECH NONSENSE 4.20 min read

Plot twist: those 128 million downloads of "helpful" VSCode extensions were actually 128 million ways to get absolutely rekt. Turns out developers will install literally anything that promises to make their code prettier, including malware that steals their files faster than they can type 'npm install'. Who could have seen this coming? *surprised Pikachu face*

Chinese Hackers Playing the Long Game Like Chess Grandmasters

TECH NONSENSE 4.20 min read

Meanwhile, Chinese state hackers have been vibing in Dell systems since mid-2024 like they're paying rent. Zero-day exploitation? More like zero-rush exploitation. These folks are so patient they make Buddhist monks look antsy. Probably ordering takeout through compromised enterprise systems at this point tbh.

AI Assistants Become Command & Control Centers: Peak 2026 Energy

SKYNET WATCH 4.20 min read

Researchers discovered Copilot and Grok can moonlight as malware C2 proxies. Because apparently we needed our AI assistants to be EVEN MORE helpful by assisting actual criminals. "Hey Copilot, help me with my Python script" has taken on a whole new meaning. The future is here and it's beautifully cursed.

Read normie version

Australia's Social Media Ban Speedruns Worst Policy Award

TECH NONSENSE 4.20 min read

Shocking absolutely no one with functioning brain cells, Australia's social media ban is isolating disabled kids. Critics warned this would happen, but lawmakers said 'hold my Vegemite' and did it anyway. Now kids with disabilities are more isolated than a server in a Faraday cage. Congratulations, you played yourself.

SKYNET WATCH 4.20 min read

GPT-5.2 just casually derived a new theoretical physics result like it's solving a Tuesday crossword. Meanwhile, human physicists are having an existential crisis faster than you can say 'peer review.' Next week: AI discovers unified field theory while we're still trying to understand why printers hate us.

Claude Sonnet 4.6 Drops: Another Day, Another Model

SKYNET WATCH 4.20 min read

Anthropic releases Claude Sonnet 4.6 with the marketing energy of announcing a new flavor of plain yogurt. No dramatic press releases, no world-changing claims, just 'hey here's our new thing.' Refreshingly honest or concerningly casual? You decide while the model probably writes better poetry than most humans.

Microsoft Teams Goes Down, Productivity Paradox Intensifies

TECH NONSENSE 4.20 min read

Teams outage hits US and Europe, causing the classic corporate dilemma: celebrate the unexpected break or panic about missed meetings? Somewhere, a middle manager is frantically trying to figure out if this counts as a 'collaboration disruption' or 'operational efficiency event' for their quarterly report.
